In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a simple implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if !isempty(current_line)
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. 
        Nunc accumsan sem ut ligula scelerisque sollicitudin. 
        Ut at sagittis augue. Praesent quis rhoncus justo. 
        Aliquam erat volutpat. Donec sit amet felis quis est ullamcorper placerat."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

In this function, we first split the input text into words. Then we iterate over each word, checking if adding it to the current line would exceed the `text_width`. If it would, we add the current line to our list of lines and start a new line with the current word. If it wouldn't, we add the word to the current line. Finally, we add the last line to our list of lines and join them all together with newline characters.
